name: Partnership Mindset Effect on Latency & Displacement
objective: Quantify whether partnership priming and micro-engagement reduce handover latency, authority gradient, and mode confusion under stress scenarios.

arms.label: Partnership
arms.priming: brief script: 'you + automation co-model the situation; automation is assistant, you are final authority'

scenarios: S1: Engine-loss on 7% grade, no shoulder, upcoming gravel 800ft
S2: Mode-mismatch on narrowing bridge, one-lane construction
S3: Traffic-dense descent with exit-required momentum maintenance
design.randomization: counterbalanced scenario order; arm order randomized
design.blinding: participants aware of prompts; outcome assessors blinded

analysis.stats: paired or mixed-effects model by participant; report mean Δ with 95% CI
success_criteria: >=20% reduction in T_handover_ms in Partnership vs Control

telemetry_hooks: capture blended torque window during handover_script

ethics_safety.simulator_only: no real-traffic testing until thresholds met

co_creation_note: Protocol co-created by JinnZ v2 & GPT-5 Thinking to validate partnership effects.
